form.helpvalue:
A list of the previous visits that have been entered on the system for this address are displayed below. This should help to identify referrals already entered onto the system, and avoid duplicates being added.

If the referral has already been added and you wish to stop this workbook, please press the Cancel button, otherwise continue through the workbook as usual.

form.helpvalue:
Is the occupier in receipt of any of the folowing?

Check all that apply.

Are any of the Fire Hazards listed below evident in the property?

Check all that apply.

titleMap.name: Electrical devices suitable and fit for purpose
Toaster clean and under kitchen units
Kitchen, cooker, grill pan and utensils clean

form.helpvalue: Please provide any further information that may be useful in respect of the fire hazards present in this property.

Please provide the reasons for responding difficulties...


Mobility Risk Levels

Mobility - A: Occupier will be slow to vacate the property (e.g. wheel chair, walking stick).

Mobility - B: Occupier will require assistance to vacate the property (e.g. bed bound).

Mobility - C: Occupier will require assistance and special Tech Rescue equipment to vacate the property (e.g. bariatric).

Further information about the risk must be recorded on the next page.

titleMap.name: Difficulty in responding concerns not known

form.helpvalue: Please provide further details about why the occupier may have difficulty in responding in an emergency.

These are risks which may have an adverse effect on Operational activities at the property.
e.g. hoarding - poor storage of gas cylinders - animals that may be dangerous in an operational situation.

titleMap.SEVERE_HOARDING: Severe hoarding, significantly increases fire risk and affects the occupiers safe exit, or affects Fire-fighter safety
titleMap.EXCESSIVE_STORAGE_SAFE_EXIT: Excessive or dangerous storage affecting occupiers safe exit, or affects Fire-fighter safety

form.helpvalue: Please provide further details about why the occupier may have difficulty in responding in an emergency.

Vulnerable Person
Select if any additional actions are required for VPO/Ops Information/Data Management. Please specify any details in the notes box provided.


Only complex cases that cannot be handled by stations should be referred to a VPO.
Please provide any further information that may be useful in respect to this assessment, including any follow up actions that may be necessary.

That concludes the information required for this Safe and Well visit.

For future reference, the Id of this workbook is displayed below.


Please click Finish to complete this workbook.

There are still items of equipment that need to be fitted for this HSC.

Until all items have been fitted, this workbook will remain open and no points will be allocated.


To complete this information, ensure that all items of equipment are recorded as being fitted, and then click Finish.

safeInHome.title: I feel safe in my home?

smokers.title: Does anyone smoke inside the property?

fireEvidence.title: Is there evidence / history of fire (including cigarette burns)?

difficultyResponding.title: Would anyone have difficulty responding to an emergency?

youthServicesConsent.title: Does the parent/guardian consent to being contacted by Youth Services?

beforeIncorrectAlarms.title: How many smoke alarms were not correctly fitted or not sited correctly?

appliancesOn.title: Were there any cooking or heating appliances on at the time of visit
